content.title: Access Vessel Mapping
content.definition: Duplex ultrasound assesses vein diameter (≥2.5mm), artery patency, and absence of central stenosis before AVF creation.
content.statement: Access Vessel Mapping is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Dialysis-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Access Vessel Mapping helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Access Vessel Mapping include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Access Vessel Mapping.

clinical_pearls: Key point about Access Vessel Mapping

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Access Vessel Mapping. Wolters Kluwer.
